title: Lola Kirke Champions Body Hair—And Body Confidence—At the Golden Globes
text:
Lola Kirke Photo: Getty Images 
Lola Kirke used the Golden Globes red carpet as a platform to support women’s bodies in more ways than one tonight. First, amid the recent push to defund Planned Parenthood , the actress accessorized her embroidered pink Andrew Gn gown with a Fuck Paul Ryan pin. But she also expressed a bold message when it came to her own body—taking the opportunity to shirk conventional Hollywood norms by stepping out with visibly grown-out underarm hair. 
Kirke isn’t the first woman to cameo her body hair on the formal red carpet. In fact, the Kirke family has a history of flaunting the natural look: Her older sister, Jemima Kirke, also opted to go untrimmed at the CFDA Fashion Awards back in 2015. In fact, going proudly unshaven has long been a theme among boundary-pushing women in Hollywood: Back in 2005, actress Drew Barrymore went natural in a barely there slip dress while arm in arm with Marc Jacobs, while Juliette Lewis has been known to skip the razor when it comes to her underarms. 
A photo posted by Lola Kirke (@lolakirke) on Dec 19, 2016 at 4:40pm PST 

Still, Kirke’s much-photographed moment is perhaps most reminiscent of Julia Roberts, who waved to the crowd with grown-out underarms at the London Notting Hill premiere in 1999. The moment was widely publicized—as well as criticized—but has since remained a pave-the-way moment for women who wish to go natural with their body hair. Because on and off the red carpet, confidence is the ultimate accessory.
